title: The problems with President Trump’s latest stock market idea
text: President Trump loves the stock market — especially when it is going up. But there’s really no way of guaranteeing that stock prices will continue to climb between now and the presidential election in November — unless, of course, the rig is in.

title: Stocks fall after Apple warns on coronavirus impact
text: Asian shares fell and Wall Street retreated from record highs on Tuesday after Apple Inc  said it will not meet its revenue guidance for the March quarter as the coronavirus outbreak slowed production and weakened demand in China.

title: Oil prices slip as coronavirus concerns linger
text: Oil prices slipped on Tuesday on lingering concerns over the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak in China and its effect on oil demand, tracking losses in financial markets.

title: U.S. stock futures retreat, Asia dips after Apple warns on virus impact
text: U.S. stock futures slipped from record levels on Tuesday after Apple Inc  said it will not meet its revenue guidance for the March quarter as the coronavirus outbreak slowed production and weakened demand in China.

title: US Will Raise Import Tariffs On EU Aircraft In March
text: In response to a recent World Trade Organization (WTO) decision that allowed the U.S.

title: A Historically Overbought Market
text: So far in 2020, the gain in the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) has already exceeded the yearly performance of the QQQ in 2011, 2015, 2016 and 2018. Is this unusual from a historic perspective?

title: Oil edges up as output cut hopes offset coronavirus concern
text: Oil prices inched up on Monday as concerns over the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak in China were offset by expectations that potential production cuts from major producers could tighten global crude supply.

title: How Millennials Could Make the Fed’s Job Harder
text: Millennials love the idea of retiring early and don’t believe in inflation. That could diminish Federal Reserve’s firepower.

title: Russell 2000 Index: Elliott Wave Points To Correction
text: The Russell 2000 Index (INDEXRUSSELL: RUT) appears to be following the main Elliott wave scenario we described in our November post, and it has slightly exceeded our upward targets.

title: Extreme weather could cause massive economic recession ‘like we’ve never seen before’
text: A shocking new study says that extreme weather events caused by climate change could result in an economic recession “the likes of which we’ve never seen before.” The research, published in Nature Energy, notes that financial markets are not taking into account the risks that catastrophic events such as floods, droughts and other extreme weather.

title: Cole Haan Begins U.S. IPO Effort
text: Cole Haan has filed to raise $100 million in an IPO, although the final figure may be higher.

title: Are High-Yield Returns Predictable? Key Metric Suggests Yes
text: Stubbornly low interest rates still have many investors reaching far and wide for yield. But for others, high-yield corporate bonds are a bridge too far.

title: 'Bear Market' Part 1: Why We Think We're Getting Close
text: Bear markets are a healthy cleansing process that removes the excesses of the past.

title: White House Forms China Trade Deal Watchdog Office
text: The White House has initiated a new office to ensure that China sticks to its commitments under the "Phase One" trade deal reached between the U.S.

title: Stock Market Breadth Analysis Reveals Healthy Level of Buying
text: Key Stock Market Takeaways: – Large-caps are leading but others are following.  – Watch industry group trends and new high list for confirmation.

title: How low can bond rates go?
text: Giddy investors in stocks have shrugged off worries about the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on the global financial markets. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq both closed at new all-time highs Friday.

title: Finding Value with Bubble Charts
text: Written by: Gary Ashton One of the most versatile tools on the Finscreener.com site is the Bubble Chart. Bubble Chart is an X and Y axis graphing tool that allows users to plot specific criterion and measure the performance of US stocks on markets such as the DOW 30, Nasdaq 100, S&P 500 or Russell 1000.

title: Current 2020 Economic Overview U.S. & Abroad
text: Fourth quarter real GDP in the US grew at a 2.1% annual rate, consistent with Q3’s pace. Personal consumption, along with federal, state and local government spending all contributed to growth during the last quarter while inventories and nonresidential fixed investment were detractors.

title: Equity Monday: Oyo’s losses, global growth concerns, and four early-stage rounds
text: Good morning friends, and welcome back to TechCrunch’s Equity Monday, a short-form audio hit to kickstart your week.

title: Coronavirus could impact 5 million companies worldwide, new research shows
text: The new coronavirus outbreak and subsequent shutdown of huge swathes of China could impact more than 5 million businesses worldwide, according to a new study.

title: Is U.S. Inflation Pressure Building?
text: Holger Schmieding, chief economist at Berenberg, and Marija Veitmane, multi-asset strategist at State Street Global Markets, discuss the outlook for the U.S. economy, inflation and financial markets.

title: WTO gives somber goods trade outlook, sees virus threat
text: Growth of global trade in goods is likely to remain weak in early 2020, the World Trade Organization (WTO) said on Monday, adding that the below-trend performance could become even worse due to the new coronavirus.

title: WTO Flashes Warning About Global Economy
text: The World Trade Organization (WTO) warned that the economy, based on world merchandise trade slowed toward the end of last year.

title: Japan GDP Drops 6.3%, Raises Specter Of Global Recession
text: The Japan Cabinet Office released GDP numbers for the fourth quarter of 2019.

title: UBS Sees Mis-Pricing in Equity Markets
text: Bhanu Baweja, chief strategist at UBS, discusses the outlook for equities amid the coronavirus outbreak and expectations of central bank liquidity boost to markets. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Global shares edge higher on Chinese support measures
text: Global shares rose on Monday as the promise of further policy stimulus to counteract the economic hit from a coronavirus outbreak calmed nervous investors.

title: Minerd Says Speculation Is ‘Out of Control’
text: Feb.17 -- Speculative energy in the financial markets is out of control. That’s according to Guggenheim Partners LLC’s Scott Minerd who is out with a stark, new warning.

title: Retail revenue could be down by as much as 90% due to coronavirus, says CEO
text: Alan Lim of E-Services Group says there is "completely no domestic consumption" now and "factories are, at best, this week at 25% production.

title: Japan on brink of recession as economy contracts, virus heightens risk
text: Japan's economy shrank at the fastest pace in almost six years in the December quarter as a sales tax hike hit consumer and business spending, raising the risk of a recession as China's coronavirus outbreak chills global activity.

title: Oil prices steady as coronavirus-related demand concerns weigh
text: Oil prices were little changed on Monday as concerns of falling fuel demand caused by the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak in China was offset by expectations that output cuts from major producers will tighten crude supply.
